meanings.definition: The state or quality of being inaccessible.
meanings.sent1: The inaccessibilities of the mountain peak made it impossible for hikers to reach the summit.
meanings.sent2: The inaccessibilities of the fortress were designed to keep intruders out.
meanings.sent3: The inaccessibilities of the secret garden led to many comical attempts to find the hidden entrance.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was guarded by inaccessibilities, making it hard for anyone to truly understand her.
meanings.sent5: The inaccessibilities of the maze were so confusing that even experienced adventurers got lost.

meanings.definition: Things that are difficult or impossible to reach or approach.
meanings.sent1: The dense forest was full of inaccessibilities, hindering the progress of the explorers.
meanings.sent2: The inaccessibilities of the high shelves required a ladder to retrieve the items stored there.
meanings.sent3: The inaccessibilities of the cookie jar led to some creative attempts to grab a treat without being caught.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a fortress with inaccessibilities that even he struggled to breach.
meanings.sent5: The inaccessibilities of the language barrier made communication challenging between the two groups.
